hashtag#hiring *Parts, Materials, and Processes Engineer - Intern with Security Clearance*, Huntsville, *United States*, fulltime hashtag#opentowork hashtag#Huntsvillejobs hashtag#Alabamajobs hashtag#ITCommunications hashtag#entrylevel hashtag#firstjob hashtag#newgrad hashtag#internship hashtag#entryleveljobs *To Apply -->*: https://lnkd.in/ggS7fuYr Job Number 673171BR Description:By bringing together people that use their passion for purposeful innovation, at Lockheed Martin we keep people safe and solve the world's most complex challenges. Our people are some of the greatest minds in the industry and truly make Lockheed Martin a great place to work. With our employees as our priority, we provide diverse career opportunities designed to propel development and boost agility. Our flexible schedules, competitive pay, and comprehensive benefits enable our employees to live a healthy, fulfilling life at and outside of work. At Lockheed Martin, we place an emphasis on empowering our employees by fostering innovation, integrity, and exemplifying the epitome of corporate responsibility. Your Mission is Ours. Lockheed Martin Space is seeking a Summer 2025 Component Engineer Intern. In this role, you will:â€¢ Participate in engineering tasks supporting a systems engineering team, â€¢ Work with experienced engineers performing in all phases of Systems Engineering that may include requirements definition, allocation and maintenance. â€¢ Support various system analyses in support of mission planning and execution. The successful candidate will be actively enrolled in an Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, or other related degree program from an accredited college/university. This position will require a government security clearance - U.S. Citizenship required.Basic Qualifications:â€¢ Currently enrolled in a Materials Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, or other related degree program from an accredited college/university. â€¢ Familiarity with data analysis software such as Microsoft Excel, Python, or Tableau. â€¢ This position requires special access to support the program and requires the selected candidate to be a US CitizenDesired Skills:â€¢ Active or Current DoD Secret Security ClearanceSecurity Clearance Statement: This position requires a government security clearance, you must be a US Citizen for consideration.Clearance Level: SecretOther Important Information You Should KnowExpression of Interest: By applying to this job, you are expressing interest in this position and could be considered for other career opportunities where similar skills and requirements have been identified as a match. Should this match be identified you may be contacted for this and future openings.Ability to Work Remotely: Onsite Full-time: The work associated with this position will be performed onsite at a designated Lockhee

LEVERAGING TRANSFERABLE SKILLS FOR CROSS-INDUSTRY SUCCESS As a mining engineer, Iâ€™ve always believed that the skills we develop in our profession can be applied beyond our primary profession. Recently, I had the opportunity to conduct a feasibility study on tobacco farming in Zambia, a research project in an entirely different fieldâ€”the agriculture sector.The task was a great challenge, given that agriculture isn't my area of expertise. However, by leveraging key skills I honed in mining, i.e., research, data analysis, and problem-solving skills, I was able to provide valuable insights that helped shape a well-informed investment strategy. The positive feedback from the client further affirmed that transferable skills are a powerful tool for growth and innovation across industries. Interestingly, my client for this research is also a mining engineer at a reputable mining company. This experience reinforced a key insight: you donâ€™t have to be confined to your field of expertise to explore new opportunities. With the right approach, such as investing in knowledge, conducting research, or hiring experts, it is possible to make informed investment decisions in any industry.In conclusion, this experience taught me an important lesson: never underestimate the power of transferable skills. As professionals, we have a wealth of knowledge that can be used to innovate and contribute to various sectors.Letâ€™s continue to be open-minded and explore new opportunities where our skills can make a difference. hashtag#MiningEngineer hashtag#TransferableSkills hashtag#Interdisciplinary hashtag#Agriculture hashtag#Research hashtag#Innovation hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#Inspiration

LEVERAGING TRANSFERABLE SKILLS FOR CROSS-INDUSTRY SUCCESS As a mining engineer, Iâ€™ve always believed that the skills we develop in our profession can be applied beyond our primary profession. Recently, I had the opportunity to conduct a feasibility study on tobacco farming in Zambia, a research project in an entirely different fieldâ€”the agriculture sector.The task was a great challenge, given that agriculture isn't my area of expertise. However, by leveraging key skills I honed in mining, i.e., research, data analysis, and problem-solving skills, I was able to provide valuable insights that helped shape a well-informed investment strategy. The positive feedback from the client further affirmed that transferable skills are a powerful tool for growth and innovation across industries. Interestingly, my client for this research is also a mining engineer at a reputable mining company. This experience reinforced a key insight: you donâ€™t have to be confined to your field of expertise to explore new opportunities. With the right approach, such as investing in knowledge, conducting research, or hiring experts, it is possible to make informed investment decisions in any industry.In conclusion, this experience taught me an important lesson: never underestimate the power of transferable skills. LEVERAGING TRANSFERABLE SKILLS FOR CROSS-INDUSTRY SUCCESS As a mining engineer, Iâ€™ve always believed that the skills we develop in our profession can be applied beyond our primary profession. Recently, I had the opportunity to conduct a feasibility study on tobacco farming in Zambia, a research project in an entirely different fieldâ€”the agriculture sector.The task was a great challenge, given that agriculture isn't my area of expertise. However, by leveraging key skills I honed in mining, i.e., research, data analysis, and problem-solving skills, I was able to provide valuable insights that helped shape a well-informed investment strategy. The positive feedback from the client further affirmed that transferable skills are a powerful tool for growth and innovation across industries. Interestingly, my client for this research is also a mining engineer at a reputable mining company. This experience reinforced a key insight: you donâ€™t have to be confined to your field of expertise to explore new opportunities. With the right approach, such as investing in knowledge, conducting research, or hiring experts, it is possible to make informed investment decisions in any industry.In conclusion, this experience taught me an important lesson: never underestimate the power of transferable skills. As professionals, we have a wealth of knowledge that can be used to innovate and contribute to various sectors.Letâ€™s continue to be open-minded and explore new opportunities where our skills can make a difference. hashtag#MiningEngineer hashtag#TransferableSkills hashtag#Interdisciplinary hashtag#Agriculture hashtag#Research hashtag#Innovation hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#Inspiration

LEVERAGING TRANSFERABLE SKILLS FOR CROSS-INDUSTRY SUCCESS As a mining engineer, Iâ€™ve always believed that the skills we develop in our profession can be applied beyond our primary profession. Recently, I had the opportunity to conduct a feasibility study on tobacco farming in Zambia, a research project in an entirely different fieldâ€”the agriculture sector.The task was a great challenge, given that agriculture isn't my area of expertise. However, by leveraging key skills I honed in mining, i.e., research, data analysis, and problem-solving skills, I was able to provide valuable insights that helped shape a well-informed investment strategy. The positive feedback from the client further affirmed that transferable skills are a powerful tool for growth and innovation across industries. Interestingly, my client for this research is also a mining engineer at a reputable mining company. This experience reinforced a key insight: you donâ€™t have to be confined to your field of expertise to explore new opportunities. With the right approach, such as investing in knowledge, conducting research, or hiring experts, it is possible to make informed investment decisions in any industry.In conclusion, this experience taught me an important lesson: never underestimate the power of transferable skills. As professionals, we have a wealth of knowledge that can be used to innovate and contribute to various sectors.Letâ€™s continue to be open-minded and explore new opportunities where our skills can make a difference. hashtag#MiningEngineer hashtag#TransferableSkills hashtag#Interdisciplinary hashtag#Agriculture hashtag#Research hashtag#Innovation hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#Inspiration

LEVERAGING TRANSFERABLE SKILLS FOR CROSS-INDUSTRY SUCCESS As a mining engineer, Iâ€™ve always believed that the skills we develop in our profession can be applied beyond our primary profession. Recently, I had the opportunity to conduct a feasibility study on tobacco farming in Zambia, a research project in an entirely different fieldâ€”the agriculture sector.The task was a great challenge, given that agriculture isn't my area of expertise. However, by leveraging key skills I honed in mining, i.e., research, data analysis, and problem-solving skills, I was able to provide valuable insights that helped shape a well-informed investment strategy. The positive feedback from the client further affirmed that transferable skills are a powerful tool for growth and innovation across industries. Interestingly, my client for this research is also a mining engineer at a reputable mining company. This experience reinforced a key insight: you donâ€™t have to be confined to your field of expertise to explore new opportunities. With the right approach, such as investing in knowledge, conducting research, or hiring experts, it is possible to make informed investment decisions in any industry.In conclusion, this experience taught me an important lesson: never underestimate the power of transferable skills. As professionals, we have a wealth of knowledge that can be used to innovate and contribute to various sectors.Letâ€™s continue to be open-minded and explore new opportunities where our skills can make a difference. hashtag#MiningEngineer hashtag#TransferableSkills hashtag#Interdisciplinary hashtag#Agriculture hashtag#Research hashtag#Innovation hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#Inspiration

LEVERAGING TRANSFERABLE SKILLS FOR CROSS-INDUSTRY SUCCESS As a mining engineer, Iâ€™ve always believed that the skills we develop in our profession can be applied beyond our primary profession. Recently, I had the opportunity to conduct a feasibility study on tobacco farming in Zambia, a research project in an entirely different fieldâ€”the agriculture sector.The task was a great challenge, given that agriculture isn't my area of expertise. However, by leveraging key skills I honed in mining, i.e., research, data analysis, and problem-solving skills, I was able to provide valuable insights that helped shape a well-informed investment strategy. The positive feedback from the client further affirmed that transferable skills are a powerful tool for growth and innovation across industries. Interestingly, my client for this research is also a mining engineer at a reputable mining company. This experience reinforced a key insight: you donâ€™t have to be confined to your field of expertise to explore new opportunities. With the right approach, such as investing in knowledge, conducting research, or hiring experts, it is possible to make informed investment decisions in any industry.In conclusion, this experience taught me an important lesson: never underestimate the power of transferable skills. LEVERAGING TRANSFERABLE SKILLS FOR CROSS-INDUSTRY SUCCESS As a mining engineer, Iâ€™ve always believed that the skills we develop in our profession can be applied beyond our primary profession. Recently, I had the opportunity to conduct a feasibility study on tobacco farming in Zambia, a research project in an entirely different fieldâ€”the agriculture sector.The task was a great challenge, given that agriculture isn't my area of expertise. However, by leveraging key skills I honed in mining, i.e., research, data analysis, and problem-solving skills, I was able to provide valuable insights that helped shape a well-informed investment strategy. The positive feedback from the client further affirmed that transferable skills are a powerful tool for growth and innovation across industries. Interestingly, my client for this research is also a mining engineer at a reputable mining company. This experience reinforced a key insight: you donâ€™t have to be confined to your field of expertise to explore new opportunities. With the right approach, such as investing in knowledge, conducting research, or hiring experts, it is possible to make informed investment decisions in any industry.In conclusion, this experience taught me an important lesson: never underestimate the power of transferable skills. LEVERAGING TRANSFERABLE SKILLS FOR CROSS-INDUSTRY SUCCESS As a mining engineer, Iâ€™ve always believed that the skills we develop in our profession can be applied beyond our primary profession. Recently, I had the opportunity to conduct a feasibility study on tobacco farming in Zambia, a research project in an entirely different fieldâ€”the agriculture sector.The task was a great challenge, given that agriculture isn't my area of expertise. However, by leveraging key skills I honed in mining, i.e., research, data analysis, and problem-solving skills, I was able to provide valuable insights that helped shape a well-informed investment strategy. The positive feedback from the client further affirmed that transferable skills are a powerful tool for growth and innovation across industries. Interestingly, my client for this research is also a mining engineer at a reputable mining company. This experience reinforced a key insight: you donâ€™t have to be confined to your field of expertise to explore new opportunities. With the right approach, such as investing in knowledge, conducting research, or hiring experts, it is possible to make informed investment decisions in any industry.In conclusion, this experience taught me an important lesson: never underestimate the power of transferable skills. LEVERAGING TRANSFERABLE SKILLS FOR CROSS-INDUSTRY SUCCESS As a mining engineer, Iâ€™ve always believed that the skills we develop in our profession can be applied beyond our primary profession. Recently, I had the opportunity to conduct a feasibility study on tobacco farming in Zambia, a research project in an entirely different fieldâ€”the agriculture sector.The task was a great challenge, given that agriculture isn't my area of expertise. However, by leveraging key skills I honed in mining, i.e., research, data analysis, and problem-solving skills, I was able to provide valuable insights that helped shape a well-informed investment strategy. The positive feedback from the client further affirmed that transferable skills are a powerful tool for growth and innovation across industries. Interestingly, my client for this research is also a mining engineer at a reputable mining company. This experience reinforced a key insight: you donâ€™t have to be confined to your field of expertise to explore new opportunities. With the right approach, such as investing in knowledge, conducting research, or hiring experts, it is possible to make informed investment decisions in any industry.In conclusion, this experience taught me an important lesson: never underestimate the power of transferable skills. As professionals, we have a wealth of knowledge that can be used to innovate and contribute to various sectors.Letâ€™s continue to be open-minded and explore new opportunities where our skills can make a difference. hashtag#MiningEngineer hashtag#TransferableSkills hashtag#Interdisciplinary hashtag#Agriculture hashtag#Research hashtag#Innovation hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#Inspiration

LEVERAGING TRANSFERABLE SKILLS FOR CROSS-INDUSTRY SUCCESS As a mining engineer, Iâ€™ve always believed that the skills we develop in our profession can be applied beyond our primary profession. Recently, I had the opportunity to conduct a feasibility study on tobacco farming in Zambia, a research project in an entirely different fieldâ€”the agriculture sector.The task was a great challenge, given that agriculture isn't my area of expertise. However, by leveraging key skills I honed in mining, i.e., research, data analysis, and problem-solving skills, I was able to provide valuable insights that helped shape a well-informed investment strategy. The positive feedback from the client further affirmed that transferable skills are a powerful tool for growth and innovation across industries. Interestingly, my client for this research is also a mining engineer at a reputable mining company. This experience reinforced a key insight: you donâ€™t have to be confined to your field of expertise to explore new opportunities. With the right approach, such as investing in knowledge, conducting research, or hiring experts, it is possible to make informed investment decisions in any industry.In conclusion, this experience taught me an important lesson: never underestimate the power of transferable skills. LEVERAGING TRANSFERABLE SKILLS FOR CROSS-INDUSTRY SUCCESS As a mining engineer, Iâ€™ve always believed that the skills we develop in our profession can be applied beyond our primary profession. Recently, I had the opportunity to conduct a feasibility study on tobacco farming in Zambia, a research project in an entirely different fieldâ€”the agriculture sector.The task was a great challenge, given that agriculture isn't my area of expertise. However, by leveraging key skills I honed in mining, i.e., research, data analysis, and problem-solving skills, I was able to provide valuable insights that helped shape a well-informed investment strategy. The positive feedback from the client further affirmed that transferable skills are a powerful tool for growth and innovation across industries. Interestingly, my client for this research is also a mining engineer at a reputable mining company. This experience reinforced a key insight: you donâ€™t have to be confined to your field of expertise to explore new opportunities. With the right approach, such as investing in knowledge, conducting research, or hiring experts, it is possible to make informed investment decisions in any industry.In conclusion, this experience taught me an important lesson: never underestimate the power of transferable skills. As professionals, we have a wealth of knowledge that can be used to innovate and contribute to various sectors.Letâ€™s continue to be open-minded and explore new opportunities where our skills can make a difference. hashtag#MiningEngineer hashtag#TransferableSkills hashtag#Interdisciplinary hashtag#Agriculture hashtag#Research hashtag#Innovation hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#Inspiration

LEVERAGING TRANSFERABLE SKILLS FOR CROSS-INDUSTRY SUCCESS As a mining engineer, Iâ€™ve always believed that the skills we develop in our profession can be applied beyond our primary profession. Recently, I had the opportunity to conduct a feasibility study on tobacco farming in Zambia, a research project in an entirely different fieldâ€”the agriculture sector.The task was a great challenge, given that agriculture isn't my area of expertise. However, by leveraging key skills I honed in mining, i.e., research, data analysis, and problem-solving skills, I was able to provide valuable insights that helped shape a well-informed investment strategy. The positive feedback from the client further affirmed that transferable skills are a powerful tool for growth and innovation across industries. Interestingly, my client for this research is also a mining engineer at a reputable mining company. This experience reinforced a key insight: you donâ€™t have to be confined to your field of expertise to explore new opportunities. With the right approach, such as investing in knowledge, conducting research, or hiring experts, it is possible to make informed investment decisions in any industry.In conclusion, this experience taught me an important lesson: never underestimate the power of transferable skills. As professionals, we have a wealth of knowledge that can be used to innovate and contribute to various sectors.Letâ€™s continue to be open-minded and explore new opportunities where our skills can make a difference. hashtag#MiningEngineer hashtag#TransferableSkills hashtag#Interdisciplinary hashtag#Agriculture hashtag#Research hashtag#Innovation hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#Inspiration

LEVERAGING TRANSFERABLE SKILLS FOR CROSS-INDUSTRY SUCCESS As a mining engineer, Iâ€™ve always believed that the skills we develop in our profession can be applied beyond our primary profession. Recently, I had the opportunity to conduct a feasibility study on tobacco farming in Zambia, a research project in an entirely different fieldâ€”the agriculture sector.The task was a great challenge, given that agriculture isn't my area of expertise. However, by leveraging key skills I honed in mining, i.e., research, data analysis, and problem-solving skills, I was able to provide valuable insights that helped shape a well-informed investment strategy. The positive feedback from the client further affirmed that transferable skills are a powerful tool for growth and innovation across industries. Interestingly, my client for this research is also a mining engineer at a reputable mining company. This experience reinforced a key insight: you donâ€™t have to be confined to your field of expertise to explore new opportunities. With the right approach, such as investing in knowledge, conducting research, or hiring experts, it is possible to make informed investment decisions in any industry.In conclusion, this experience taught me an important lesson: never underestimate the power of transferable skills. As professionals, we have a wealth of knowledge that can be used to innovate and contribute to various sectors.Letâ€™s continue to be open-minded and explore new opportunities where our skills can make a difference. hashtag#MiningEngineer hashtag#TransferableSkills hashtag#Interdisciplinary hashtag#Agriculture hashtag#Research hashtag#Innovation hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#Inspiration

LEVERAGING TRANSFERABLE SKILLS FOR CROSS-INDUSTRY SUCCESS As a mining engineer, Iâ€™ve always believed that the skills we develop in our profession can be applied beyond our primary profession. Recently, I had the opportunity to conduct a feasibility study on tobacco farming in Zambia, a research project in an entirely different fieldâ€”the agriculture sector.The task was a great challenge, given that agriculture isn't my area of expertise. However, by leveraging key skills I honed in mining, i.e., research, data analysis, and problem-solving skills, I was able to provide valuable insights that helped shape a well-informed investment strategy. The positive feedback from the client further affirmed that transferable skills are a powerful tool for growth and innovation across industries. Interestingly, my client for this research is also a mining engineer at a reputable mining company. This experience reinforced a key insight: you donâ€™t have to be confined to your field of expertise to explore new opportunities. With the right approach, such as investing in knowledge, conducting research, or hiring experts, it is possible to make informed investment decisions in any industry.In conclusion, this experience taught me an important lesson: never underestimate the power of transferable skills. As professionals, we have a wealth of knowledge that can be used to innovate and contribute to various sectors.Letâ€™s continue to be open-minded and explore new opportunities where our skills can make a difference. hashtag#MiningEngineer hashtag#TransferableSkills hashtag#Interdisciplinary hashtag#Agriculture hashtag#Research hashtag#Innovation hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#Inspiration

hashtag#hiring *Parts, Materials, and Processes Engineer - Intern with Security Clearance*, Huntsville, *United States*, fulltime hashtag#opentowork hashtag#Huntsvillejobs hashtag#Alabamajobs hashtag#ITCommunications hashtag#entrylevel hashtag#firstjob hashtag#newgrad hashtag#internship hashtag#entryleveljobs *To Apply -->*: https://lnkd.in/ggS7fuYr Job Number 673171BR Description:By bringing together people that use their passion for purposeful innovation, at Lockheed Martin we keep people safe and solve the world's most complex challenges. Our people are some of the greatest minds in the industry and truly make Lockheed Martin a great place to work. With our employees as our priority, we provide diverse career opportunities designed to propel development and boost agility. Our flexible schedules, competitive pay, and comprehensive benefits enable our employees to live a healthy, fulfilling life at and outside of work. At Lockheed Martin, we place an emphasis on empowering our employees by fostering innovation, integrity, and exemplifying the epitome of corporate responsibility. Your Mission is Ours. Lockheed Martin Space is seeking a Summer 2025 Component Engineer Intern. LEVERAGING TRANSFERABLE SKILLS FOR CROSS-INDUSTRY SUCCESS As a mining engineer, Iâ€™ve always believed that the skills we develop in our profession can be applied beyond our primary profession. Recently, I had the opportunity to conduct a feasibility study on tobacco farming in Zambia, a research project in an entirely different fieldâ€”the agriculture sector.The task was a great challenge, given that agriculture isn't my area of expertise. However, by leveraging key skills I honed in mining, i.e., research, data analysis, and problem-solving skills, I was able to provide valuable insights that helped shape a well-informed investment strategy. The positive feedback from the client further affirmed that transferable skills are a powerful tool for growth and innovation across industries. Interestingly, my client for this research is also a mining engineer at a reputable mining company. This experience reinforced a key insight: you donâ€™t have to be confined to your field of expertise to explore new opportunities. With the right approach, such as investing in knowledge, conducting research, or hiring experts, it is possible to make informed investment decisions in any industry.In conclusion, this experience taught me an important lesson: never underestimate the power of transferable skills. As professionals, we have a wealth of knowledge that can be used to innovate and contribute to various sectors.Letâ€™s continue to be open-minded and explore new opportunities where our skills can make a difference. hashtag#MiningEngineer hashtag#TransferableSkills hashtag#Interdisciplinary hashtag#Agriculture hashtag#Research hashtag#Innovation hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#Inspiration
